newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Salomon cuts Intel.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Salomon cuts Intel.

text.p: -- Salomon Brothers said analyst Erika Klauer downgraded Intel Corp to hold from strong buy.
-- cited concern about the new record stock price, and concerns about the coming fourth quarter results.
-- shares were trading up 1/8 to 104-7/8 in late morning exchange trading.
-- noted that since rating was raised to strong buy in January, stock has risen 236 percent.
-- said concerned about fourth quarter, citing company announcement in August that it would not have usual pricing cuts in November which "may signify some order risks in the fourth quarter."
-- said there is possibility that strong third-quarter order surge may be due to "front loading" by customers, who had no incentive to put off ordering in fourth quarter.
-- kept earnings estimates at $4.60 per share for 1996, $6 for 1997, and $7 for 1998.
